results.title: A Happy childhood
results.brief_description: An English language version of a Russian propaganda film promoting the virtues of Stalinist policies for the protection of children’s welfare. If much of this socialist child-rearing looks severe and Spartan, the film is punctuated throughout by genuine moments of charm and whimsy. In many respects this is an enchanting film; accordingly, the film is a fascinating study in propaganda cinema.
results.description: An English language version of a Russian propaganda film promoting the virtues of Stalinist policies for the protection of children’s welfare. results.creator_credit: Lawrence Mollot and Sam Orleans and Associates

results.title: A guide to landscape painting with Del Newport
results.creator_credit: Coral Coast Video, Robert Dunn, Val Osborn and Leigh Kidd
results.brief_description: Del Newport, prominent teacher and exhibition artist with national and overseas recognition shows step by step the fine detail and intricacies of landscape painting. As she paints a landscape from memory, Del explains what she is doing and why.

results.title: A Great white bird
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Colin Low, Desmond Dew and Michael McKennirey
results.brief_description: This film documents the efforts of a group of people in Canada and the United States to sav the whooping crane from extinction. They display great determination and resourcefulness in their dealings with this mysterious, fiercely independent pre-Ice Age creature.

results.title: A Great ship
results.creator_credit: Anthony Gilkison, Rayant Pictures, British Information Services and John Reeve
results.brief_description: P&O decided in 1955 to build the largest passenger liner since World War II, the Canberra. This documentary focuses on the construction of the vessel, followed by her maiden voyage.

results.title: A Great day to go
results.creator_credit: Ronald Bowie, New Zealand National Film Unit and Hugh Macdonald
results.brief_description: A variety of people are shown enjoying water activities, e.g. surfing, boating, fishing. Through their thoughtlessness, tragedies occur in the water. Produced for the New Zealand National Water Safety Council.

results.title: A Grain of sand
results.creator_credit: UNICEF, John Luck and David Keith Hardy
results.brief_description: Firstly children’s needs are dramatised through a poem by William Blake and drawings by Ronald Searle. Then we follow a 10 year old Tunisian Arab boy to a health clinic, a school and a vocational training centre - three concrete ways to help meet children’s needs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: UNICEF, John Luck and David Keith Hardy

results.title: A Gourmet tour. - Volume 1.
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Gian Manara
results.brief_description: The last decade has seen the emergence of an exciting and unique cuisine in Australia, arising from the multi-cultural nature of our society and the abundance of fresh, natural ingredients. This program is a gourmet’s tour of some of the best restaurants in the forefront of this development. It profiles the style of these famous restaurants, their chefs and details how to prepare some of their favourite dishes. Divided into three sections: Dining in Sydney and Dining with wine. Restaurants include Cleopatra’s, The Cellar, Berowra Waters, Taylors, Bangkok, The Barn, Cotswold House and Craigmoor.
